title: Unionville High School Student's Invention Earns National Recognition
snippet: Pranavh Joshua Vallabhaneni, a rising sophomore at Unionville High School, has earned national recognition for his award-winning invention, a hot-car-alert device called Baby Saver, writes Marc Narducci for The Philadelphia Inquirer. When Vallabhaneni started hearing tragic stories about babies dying in overheated cars four years ago, he immediately began thinking of ways to prevent this from ...

title: Teen inventor wins awards for technology that could save kids' lives
snippet: Pranavh Joshua Vallabhaneni with his Baby Saver prototype invention at his home in Chadds Ford, Pennsylvania, on August 7, 2020. Vallabhaneni, who is entering his sophomore year at Unionville High School, won first place in his grade category and also the Safety Award for his invention, Baby Saver - Hot Car Alert Device from Invention Convention Worldwide.
